From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Geocaching is an outdoor recreational activity, in which the participants use a Global Positioning System (GPS) receiver or mobile device and other navigational techniques to hide and seek containers, called “geocaches” or “caches”, anywhere in the world.

A typical cache is a small waterproof container containing a logbook where the geocacher enters the date they found it and signs it with their established code name. After signing the log, the cache must be placed back exactly where the person found it. Larger containers such as plastic storage containers (Tupperware or similar) or ammunition boxes can also contain items for trading, usually toys or trinkets of little financial value, although sometimes they are sentimental. Geocaching shares many aspects with benchmarking, trigpointing, orienteering, treasure-hunting,letterboxing, and waymarking.

For the traditional geocache, a geocacher will place a waterproof container containing a log book (with pen or pencil) and trade items then record the cache’s coordinates. These coordinates, along with other details of the location, are posted on a listing site (see list of some sites below). Other geocachers obtain the coordinates from that listing site and seek out the cache using their GPS handheld receivers. The finding geocachers record their exploits in the logbook and online, but then must return the cache to the same coordinates so that other geocachers may find it. Geocachers are free to take objects (except the logbook, pencil, or stamp) from the cache in exchange for leaving something of similar or higher value.

Typical cache “treasures” are not high in monetary value but may hold personal value to the finder. Aside from the logbook, common cache contents are unusual coins or currency, small toys, ornamental buttons, CDs, or books. Also common are objects that are moved from cache to cache called “hitchhikers”, such as Travel Bugs or Geocoins, whose travels may be logged and followed online. Cachers who initially place a Travel Bug or Geocoins often assign specific goals for their trackable items. Examples of goals are to be placed in a certain cache a long distance from home, or to travel to a certain country, or to travel faster and farther than other hitchhikers in a race. Higher value items are occasionally included in geocaches as a reward for the First to Find (called “FTF”), or in locations which are harder to reach. Dangerous or illegal items, weapons, food and pornography are generally not allowed and are specifically against the rules of most geocache listing sites.

If a geocache has been vandalized or stolen it is said to have been “muggled” or “plundered.” The former term plays off the fact that those not familiar with geocaching are called muggles, a term borrowed from the Harry Potter series of books which was rising in popularity at the same time Geocaching got its start.

“When you talk about our king, he is not only a great king but he is a good king, and I make a distinction. You can be a great man with so many shortcomings and so many faults. But when you say he is a good man, to me it means more. The fact that he is a good king personally means much more than he is a great king. To be a good king, to be a good man, it is something you have to earn – you do not inherit it.”

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE:

Amazing Geocaching is a popular game that people in global world are interested. Let you know more information about geocaching.

Experience Difference of Geocaching

Bangsaen, Chonburi, Thailand- January 10, 2014

Geocaching has different rules. Each countries have their style and tradition for playing it. Many people always have different caches such as puzzle cache, multi-cache, event cache, etc. Most of them use GPS to find some hints of logbook in the box. Here are well-know examples of Geocaching’s rules in countries.

Geocaching in Japan – Method of Geocaching in Japan’s same to Geocaching original. In Japan they have more than 4,000 hidden places. A general rule, hidden place should be in interesting locations; therefore, most hidden places were in temples, in forests and on mountaintops in the centre of Tokyo. Because Geocaching was interesting, Japanese were interested it. In addition, the number of people continues to grow.

Geocaching in Washington – Washington’s one traditional cache is in a small neighborhood park, and there are plenty of those around the city although, like any urban area, they will be smaller and less plentiful than in outlying areas. People used their own GPS receivers to find the container and shared their experiences online.

Our group is a part of sharing good experience through this game. If you need to get same special time in your life, let us be a part of each other.

 

Contact:

Amazing Geocaching team

WordPress: http://amazinggeocaching.wordpress.com/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Amazing-Geocaching/452235514881792

AmazingGeocaching

The Blog Logo 

The Blog Slogan 

Giving presents can be more than surprising

Introduction 

Amazing Geocaching is a game of finding present as I mentioned above. It was contained important thing that sender wants to give to receiver.It is making people intend to choose the present more and more because it is a famous box that makes everyone interest. So, it makes senders intend to choose the best thing to their receivers. It is making the receivers enjoy with it because it makes the interest and excite for guesser and finding it. The important thing of this game is giving good relationship with each others because they have to help each others for giving and finding their present. It would be a part of building relationship of them and everybody in the world.

Amazing Geocaching is a game for finding some presents from senders. The blog will let you know how to start this game. It will show the experience from everyone who ever plays this game. It will be interesting, exciting and make relationship with all senders and receivers.

Hunt me if you want to know me!

Find me if you want to get some gift from me!
